```{r}
pvalGraphs = function(n,k){
  data = generateData(n,k)
  A = data[[1]]
  B = data[[2]]
  
  result = arrayPerm(A,B,silent = T)
  angle = result[[1]]
  pval = result[[2]]
  
  return(list(angle,pval))
}
```

```{r}
pt=pb=rep(0,10) #set up a blank string to store powers in
mvals=seq(0,.6,,10) #sequence of values from 22 to 25, containing 10

for(m in 1:10){ #start of outer loop
  
  mval=mvals[m] #grab a value from mvals
  countt=0 #reset counts
  countb=0
  
  for(i in 1:10){ #loop to calculate power based on 1000 samples
    if(pvalGraphs(10,5)<.05){
      countt=countt+1
    }
    if(pvalGraphs(20,5)<.05){
      countb=countb+1
    }
  }
  
  pt[m]=countt/10 #store power in pt for t-test
  pb[m]=countb/10 #store power in pb for Sign test
  
}

#Plot power against the values from 22 to 25 (true centers)
plot(mvals,pb,type="l",xlab="True center",ylab="power",main="Cauchy, scale=1",col=2)
lines(mvals,pt)
legend(22,1,lty=c(1,1),col=c(1,2),legend=c("t-test","sign test"))
```
